message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a unique and valuable item that I think you'll really appreciate. I'm willing to sell it to you for $120.
I'm interested in the product, but $120 is a bit steep for me. I'd like to make a counteroffer of $90. I'm willing to pay that much for this product.
I understand that $90 is a bit low for me, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can offer you the product for $110. It's a fair price considering the value it brings
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but $110 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to go up to $100, but that's my final offer. Can you meet me at that price?
I'm not willing to go any lower than $110, but I'm willing to make a compromise. I can offer you a slight discount, and meet you at $105. It's the lowest price I'm willing to accept
I appreciate your willingness to make a compromise, but $105 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to go up to $98, but that's my final offer. Can you meet me at that price?
I'm starting to think we're getting close to a deal. I'm willing to meet you at $102, but that's as low as I can go. It's a good compromise, considering the value of the product
I appreciate your willingness to meet me at $102, but I'm still not comfortable with that price. I'm willing to go up to $95, but that's my final offer. Can you meet me at that price?
I'm starting to think we're getting a bit too far apart. I'm willing to meet you at $99, but that's as low as I can go. It's a fair price, considering the product's value
I appreciate your willingness to meet me at $99, but I'm still not comfortable with that price. I'm willing to go up to $92, but that's my final offer. Can you meet me at that price?
